intro: Notanthera sternbergianus, commonly known as the desert aster, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh, dry conditions. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Notanthera sternbergianus plays an important role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing nectar for pollinators.
